gears.sidescroller.world.machines

Class ConveyorBeltSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • gears.sidescroller.world.core.ObjectInWorld
      • gears.sidescroller.world.machines.AbstractMachine
        • gears.sidescroller.world.machines.ConveyorBeltSegment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collidable

    public class ConveyorBeltSegment
extends AbstractMachine
    A ConveryorBeltSegment is a machine which will move AbstractEntities in a given direction, assuming it is powered.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConveyorBeltSegment

        public ConveyorBeltSegment(int x,
                           int y,
                           boolean selfPowering,
                           int speed,
                           Direction movesStuffInThisDirection)
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of this conveyor belt, measured in pixel-space
        y - the y-coordinate of this conveyor belt, measured in pixel-space
        selfPowering - whether or not this should automatically provide power to itself
        speed - how fast this moves AbstractEntities that collide with it, measured in pixel-space
        movesStuffInThisDirection - what direction this moves AbstractEntities in

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Description copied from class: AbstractMachine
        Updates the machine. Note that this method is only invoked when the isPowered method returns true, so you needn't check for yourself. Machines can use this method to update animation frames, if you want.
        Specified by:
        update in class AbstractMachine
